page.title: 05HURLFORD/CROOKEDHOLM HOUSING
page.content: Councillor Nesbit was interviewed about the housing in Hurlford and Crookedholm. The first houses in Crookedholm were built in the 1930's by the authority who built 64 council houses. Another 78 were built between 1946-1959. Some more were built round 1980. Crookedholm was built before Hurlford. The population of Hurlford is 5000, much more than Crookedholm's 1180. The architect who built the houses was Clark Fyffe. In the olden days there were houses like dens. About ten peole slept in the same room. Some people even slept in the kitchen. Now there are 1350 council houses in Hurlford not including all the private houses. Seright Square, one of the biggest streets in Crookedholm, was built in 1930.
